Posts.Content: On 2/20/2008 TerrySuzanne wrote: Hi everyone, I would like to know iwhen anyone out there has quit taking the Aromasin and similar type drugs...has the pain in your hands and feet gone away?     Hi, TerrySuzanne - After 10 months on Femara for met breast cancer, I quit taking it about 3-1/2 weeks ago because the pain in my wrist/thumb and jaw were debilitating. I then had two acupuncture treatments. The pain in my jaw is gone now and my wrist/thumb are much improved. I would definitely recommend acupuncture. (Naturopath said eat no tomatoes, potatos or green pepper because they contribute to the pain.) I think I was developing ONJ and there are dozens of lawsuits around that! My oncologist wants me to try Aromasin now. That's how I found this board. I'm not sure if I'll take it... it sounds a lot like Femara.
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: Hello again - I asked my RN/social worker if she knew of anyone and she recommended Dr. R. Not all naturopaths offer acupuncture but I asked Dr. R about massage and where I might get it and it sort of led naturally into discussion of acupuncture. Is there a social worker attached to your cancer clinic or hospital that might steer you to one? Maybe a nurse you trust? Not all allopaths are averse to other forms of treatment! LOL. You could even use the excuse of wanting nutrition counseling -- which is what I iniitially went to Dr. R for. I juice daily now and good nutrition has also helped me. I'm in the Twin Cities. Where are you? Good luck. to you. Keep me posted. MaryLynn
